is a charming fishing village in the
, about 1.5 hours by road or rail North from the capital City of Inverness.

value: http://www.timespan.org.uk Timespan Museum and art gallery

, open Easter to October, with its fascinating exhibitions of local life, natural heritage and events - such as the old gold rush - you can still pan for gold further up the valley.  Or take a GPS guide to that site and others from Timespan - there are good walks and drives in the area, with real wilderness to explore within a few miles.

The gallery and shop show the best art and crafts from local and national makers, and there is a great cafe with homebakes and the best position in town - right on the river bank, with views of curious seals and otters if you are lucky!
